title: USA: 8 Brazilian workers sue Starbucks over alleged forced labour by company's supplier
desc: Eight Brazilian workers have filed a civil lawsuit against Starbucks in the USA with the support of International Rights Advocates (IRA), alleging they were subjected to trafficking and forced labour by a Starbuck’s supplier. Simultaneously, advocacy group Coffee Watch has petitioned  U.S. Customs and Border Protection to block Brazilian coffee imports from Starbucks and other major companies, including Nestlé, Jacobs Douwe Egberts, Dunkin’, Illy and McDonald’s.

USA: Consumer group files false advertising lawsuit against Starbucks over allegations that it sources "ethical" coffee and tea from farms involved in human rights abuses
desc: National Consumers League sued Starbucks before the Superior Court of the District of Columbia, accusing the coffee company of false advertising, alleging that it obtains tea and coffee from suppliers implicated in human rights abuses.
